defs: = ಜೈನಧರ್ಮ.
the observance of Jaina dogmas.
the doctrines, tenets of Jainism; Jaina doctrine.
= ಜೈನಧರ್ಮ.
= ಜೈನಧರ್ಮ.
a kind of fire-cracker.
of, related to, according to the mīmāmsā(pūrva mīmāmsa) philosopy founded by the celebrated sage Jaimini.
one of the six principal schools of Indian philosophy, propounded by the sage Jaimini; mīmāmsa; pūrva mīmāmsa.
a follower of this philosophy.
a building for the confinement of people who are awaiting trial or who have been convicted of offences; a jail; a prison.
related to the soul, life or living beings.
= ಜೈವಿಕಕ್ರಿಯೆ.
a man living for relatively longer time; a long-lived man.
the moon.
related to the soul, activities or properties of life or living beings; biotic.
any of the activities that is natural for a living being and happening in the body while alive.

to win - a) to finish first in a race, contest or the like; b) to succeed by striving; c) to gain the victory; to overcome an adversary; d) to succeed in reaching (a place, condition, etc.), esp. by great effort; e) to get by effort, as through labour, competition or conquest; f) to gain (a prize, fame, etc.); g) to be successful in (a game, legal dispute, battle, etc.) or against odds; h) to make (one's way), as by effort or ability; i) to attain or reach (a point, goal, etc.); j) to gain (favour, love, consent, etc.), as by qualities or influence; k) to gain the consent or support of.
a lulling sound.
the temporary state of being unconscious.
a bunch - a) a cluster or tuft of things growing together; b) a collection of things of the same kind fastened or grouped together.
a state of mental distress; trouble; agony.
a complicated, perplexed condition; tangle.
a variety of sugar-cane; .

any of numerous orthopterous insects of the family Blattidae, characterised by a flattened body, long antenna, rapid movements, and nocturnal habits and including several common household pests; cockroach.
little scales or flakes of dead skin formed on the scalp; dandruff.
the reed Typha angustata of Typhaceae family; elephant grass; reed mace.
the condition of being tangled, interwoven in a disorderly manner.
that which is soft, shapeless (as soft mud from trampling).
= ಜೊಂಡಗರ್ಬು.
to become soft and shapeless mass (as from trampling).
a small or humble dwelling of simple construction, esp. one made of natural materials, as of branches of plants, bamboo splits, hay, etc.; a hut.
a bunch - a) a cluster or tuft of things growing together; b) a collection of things of the same kind fastened or grouped together.

to cause to move frequently to and from; to cause to vibrate; to shake (an object).
to fill (oneself) in (something) tightly; to be tightly packed in.
to quiver, shiver from fear, cold, etc.; to tremble.
to prevent (something) from happening; to avoid (a difficult or dangerous situation).
temporary loss of one's bodily awareness, resulting from rapture, melody, tiredness, etc.; the state of being stupefied.
a state in which the mind and senses are dulled for want of sleep; sleepiness; drowsiness.
a cluster of things that are naturally grown together; a bunch.
that which packed tightly together or is dense.
a latticework supported by pillars, and is covered by intertwining vines; an arbour.
to grow less in intensity, vigour, enthusiasm, etc.; to be in a depressed mood or condition.
to reduce (oneself) in size or volume, intensity (as one's voice); to shrink; to contract (oneself).
to feel dejected; to cast down in spirit; to get disheartened; to be depressed.
skill in using one's hands or mind; cleverness; dexterity.
the outer protective covering of a fruit, sugarcane, etc.
the act or process of becoming small in size, intensity; a shrinking, contracting (oneself).
the sharp, acid taste of lemon juice, vinegar, tamarind fruit or other green fruit, etc. sour taste.
= ಜೊಟ.
that which is without any worth or of no use, importance or value.
a grain that is not properly developed or is hollow.

a natural pond on a hill or mountain.

a place that is depressed position compared to the places surrounding it; a hollow or low place.

a band, collar or piece of rope binding the yoke to the neck of an ox.

any of a pair.

the condition of being prepared; preparation; readiness.
the state or condition of being the same in power, value, rank, etc.; equality; parity.
a set of two successive lines following a ಸುಳಾದಿ, a particular type of Kannaḍa compositions; a couplet.

together - a) in or into a gathering, group, mass or place; b) in or into contact, collision, union, etc. with each other.

friendship; companionship.

to collect (as people together, money etc.); to organise.
(used in lighter conversation); to sever one's friendly relation with (another); to part with or break off.
a song sung or to be sung together; a chorus song.

ಜೋತಾಡು jōtāḍu to be hanging, dangling; 2. (rarely) to be full to the brim; to be filled completely (with water) (said of water tanks, reservoirs, etc.); ಜೋತುಗೊಳ್ಳು jōtugoḷḷu = ಜೋತುಬೀಳು; ಜೋತುಬೀಳು jōtu bīḷu to depend on; to rely (on for support); 2. to remain firm and resolute to (a principle, argument, way of thinking); ಜೋತುಹಾಕು jōtu hāku to hand (something) as to dangle freely at one end); ಜೋಲವಿಡು jōlaviḍu = ಜೋತುಹಾಕು.
the state of being dangling; a being hanged.
the quality or condition of being lose or oversized.
the legs of a person who is unable to walk or stand steadily (as from weakness or impairment.
(fig.) a person who entertains or acts (unreasonably) on, slanders, false statement of another about a third person.
an earring with a hanging.
to cause to swing, dangle; to hang.
to hang and move to and fro (as fruits on a tree); to hang down (as a person on his hands from a branch).
the mood resulting from depression, disappointments, etc.; low spirits; gloominess.
= ಜೋಲುಮೋರೆ.
a glum, sad or disconsolate facial expression; a long face.
= ಜೋಲುಬೀಳು.
the condition of a limb being weakened in or deprived of the power of feeling or moving; numbness.
to become numb physically.
the state of being pleased or satisfied.
a pleasing, soothing speech.
a woman (in gen.).
outward form or appearance; aspect; semblance; guise.
a man who acts in plays, movies, etc.; an actor.
the shape, outline of something (as seen from outside).
reverence shown by joining the both the palms and usu. slightly bending the head (as to a deity, a person, etc.); salutation; obeisance.
a request for help, restraint, etc.; a memorandum.
a self-immolation by women when their husbands are killed in a war in order not to be sexually molested by the enemy soldiers (which was prevalent in Rajāstāna, in Western India in olden days).
a particular mode in music .
to solute by joining both the palms together and bending the head slightly.
= ಜೋಹರ1.
= ಜೋಹರ2.
= ಜೋಹರ1.
= ಜೋಹರಿಸು.
a term used to encourage, applaud etc.; 'well-donṛ, 'bravo'.
the grass Sorghum vulgare (Andropogon sorghum) of Poaceae family, that has solid stem (which is used as fodder), and which bears large panicles of spikelets with numerous glossy grains; great millet.
its millet used as food.
a fixed compensation periodically paid to a person for regular work or services; salary.

the obligation one owes toward another who has fed, helped in getting livelihood, etc. ಜೋಳಕ್ಕೆ ತಪ್ಪು jōḷakke tappu to become an ingrate or act ungratefully; ಜೋಳದ ಪಾಳಿ jōḷada pāḷi = ಜೋಳವಾಳಿ; ಜೋಳದ ಪಾೞಿ jōḷada pāłi = ಜೋಳವಾಳಿ; ಜೋಳದ ಬರ jōḷada bara an acute shortage of food (as during a prolonged period of drought); ಜೋಳದ ಹಂಗು jōḷada hangu = ಜೋಳವಾಳಿ.
a man who has turned to be an ingrate towards a person who had fed, helped him in getting his livelihood at difficult times.
an acute, contagious viral disease, caused by the varicella zoster virus, usu. of young children, characterised by fever and eruption of blisters on the skin and mucous membranes; chicken-pox.
= ಜೋಳೆಯ.
= ಜೋಳವಾಳಿ.
the obligation one owes toward another who has fed, helped in getting livelihood, etc.
any service, help returned to the person who had fed or helped at times of difficulty.
a man grateful to his master or the one who helped him.
the quality of being grateful to the person who had fed earlier.
= ಜೋಳವಾಳಿ.
equality in status, rank, position etc.
two identical, similar or corresponding things that are matched for use together; two individuals who are similar or in some way associated; a pair.
a large number of persons gathered together at a place.
a small, flat ornament worn by women on the top of the forehead at line dividing the combed hair.
the nozzle of a water-vessel.
a written message.
the act or fact of being associated with; an association.
the act of pairing two similar things together.
a container made of a long cloth by joining and tying four ends together, which can be hanged on to one's shoulder.
similar one used tied to a beam or roof of a house, used as a swinging cradle for children.
to pair (two similar persons, things together).
